data.question: What is the color and form of monomeric tBuLi·(R,R)-TMCDA when it crystallizes?
At what temperature does a suspension of tBuLi and (R,R)-TMCDA in n-pentane become clear?
What compound is formed when the solution of tBuLi and (R,R)-TMCDA reacted at room temperature with MePh2SiCl?
data.answer: Compound 5, the silylated reaction product of α-lithiated (R,R)-TMCDA

data.question: What is the crystal system and space group of α-lithiated (R,R)-TMCDA (4)?
data.answer: Orthorhombic crystal system in the space group P212121

data.question: What facilitates the α-lithiation in monomeric tBuLi·(R,R)-TMCDA?
data.answer: The spatial proximity of the reacting groups, in agreement with the CIPE concept

data.question: What is the calculated reaction barrier for the intramolecular metalation of TMCDA starting from monomeric tBuLi·(R,R)-TMCDA?
Why is N,N’-dimethylpiperazine not lithiated by tBuLi?
data.answer: Because monomeric molecular structures or transition states are only poorly stabilized and a corresponding transition state in a dimer also lies too high energetically

data.question: What is the expected outcome of the reaction between tBuLi and (R,R)-TMCDA at room temperature?
What does the formation of monomeric tBuLi·(R,R)-TMCDA indicate about the reactivity of saturated alkyl lithium compounds?
data.answer: That monomeric structures are usually assumed to be the reactive species in commercially available saturated alkyl lithium compounds

data.question: What is the significance of the complex-induced proximity effect (CIPE) in the context of this study?
data.answer: It explains the high reactivity and possibility of deprotonation due to the pre-coordination of tBuLi to (R,R)-TMCDA

data.question: How does the structure of monomeric tBuLi·(R,R)-TMCDA compare to its dimeric counterparts in terms of Li-C bond lengths?
data.answer: tBuLi·(R,R)-TMCDA has shorter Li-C bonds than dimeric compounds

data.question: What does the formation of [(R,R)-TMCDA-Li]3 as a trimer indicate about the behavior of alkyl lithium compounds without Lewis bases?
data.answer: That alkyl lithium compounds preferentially exist as hexameric or tetrameric aggregates without Lewis bases

data.question: Is the ligand (R,R)-TMCDA sterically more demanding than (cid:1)-sparteine?
Does the coordination polymer [(tBuLi)2·(N,N’-dimethylpiperazine)]1 (6) form smaller aggregates due to its spatial demand?
Is the reaction barrier for the intramolecular metalation of TMCDA starting from monomeric tBuLi·(R,R)-TMCDA higher than 100 kJ mol-1?
Can the α-lithiation of (R,R)-TMCDA be explained without assuming a monomeric tBuLi·(R,R)-TMCDA precursor?
Is the α-lithiation of amines usually accessible by direct deprotonation?
Does the presence of a second nitrogen center not affect the deprotonation process?
Is the compound [(R,R)-TMCDA-Li]3 one of the few known dimeric alkyl lithium compounds?
Is the reaction of tBuLi and (R,R)-TMCDA in n-pentane at -78 °C expected to yield a monomeric structure?
